Message.Title: Duplicated I/O units on I/O bus <Local>
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration for I/O unit <> is invalid.
There is already another user-defined I/O unit connected to the I/O bus <Local>.
Only one user-defined I/O unit may be connected to the I/O bus <Local>.
This I/O unit has been rejected.
Message.Actions: Correct the I/O configuration.

Message.Title: Power fail restore full
Message.Description:
I/O unit <> could not be setup for power failure restore.
The table for power fail is full.
Message.Actions: Remove some other I/O units from the restore list.

Message.Title: Option Multiple Serial Ports is not installed
Message.Description: The system has attempted to address the serial port <>, and failed.
Message.Consequences: The connector and the physical channel using the connector will not be available for use.
Message.Causes: The option, Multiple Serial Ports, has not been installed in the system.
Message.Actions:
1. If the option is required: configure a new system WITH this option, and install the system.
2. If the option is NOT required: remove the unsupported communication channels from the configuration.

Message.Title: Cross connection with non digital resultant signal
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration is invalid.
The parameter <Resultant I/O signal> of one of the cross connections refer to a I/O signal <>, that is not digital.
Only digital I/O signals can be cross connected.
This cross connection has been rejected.
Message.Actions: Remove the non-digital I/O signal from the cross connection.

Message.Title: I/O signal mapped outside the I/O unit data area
Message.Description:
Cannot change physical state of I/O signal <> to VALID.
The reason is that the I/O signal is mapped to bit(s) that lies outside the data area of the I/O unit it is assigned to.
I/O signal assigned to I/O unit <>
I/O signal mapped to bit(s): <>
Output data area size for the I/O unit is bits
Input data area size for the I/O unit is bits
Message.Consequences: The physical state of this I/O signal remains NOT VALID.
Message.Actions:
1. Check that the unit mapping of the I/O signal is correct.
2. Check that the I/O signal is assigned to the correct I/O unit.
3. Check the system parameters Connection Input/Output size on the unit type, it is possible to increase those parameters on some unit types.

Message.Title: Slave configuration invalid
Message.Description: The I/O unit <> configured on the master address is not valid as an internal slave.
Message.Actions:
1. Change the address on the I/O unit.
2. Change the unit type on the unit to DN_SLAVE.

Message.Title: I/O queue overload
Message.Description: The I/O queue handling input and output I/O signals to and from the system has been overloaded.
Message.Consequences: The system will go to status SYS STOP.
Message.Causes: This is caused by too frequent signal changes or too large bursts of signal changes, generated by input I/O signals or cross connections between I/O signals.
Message.Actions:
Check the cross connections. How to check the configuration file is detailed in the Trouble Shooting Manual.
2. Check the frequency of input I/O signals from any external equipment connected to the system. Make sure it is not abnormal, and change if required.
3. If an extremely heavy I/O load is normal and required, investigate whether programming delays in the RAPID application may solve the problem.

Message.Title: Safety I/O queue overload
Message.Description: The safety I/O queue handling safety input and output I/O signals has been overloaded.
Message.Consequences: The system will go to status SYS HALT.
Message.Causes: This is caused by too frequent signal changes of safety I/O signals. Sometimes this may be due to erratic ground connection in I/O signals from external equipment.
Message.Actions:
1. Repeated safety input I/O signals will cause the system to halt. See the error log for other faults that may cause the condition.
2. Check the grounding of each signal from any external equipment affecting the safety I/O signals.
3. Check the frequency of input I/O signals from any external equipment connected to the system. Make sure it is not abnormal, and change is required.

Message.Title: Cross connection I/O queue overload
Message.Description: The cross connection I/O queue handling input and output I/O signals to and from the system has been overloaded.
Message.Consequences: The system will go to status SYS STOP.
Message.Causes: This is caused by too frequent signal changes or too large bursts of signal changes, generated by input or output I/O signals being actors in cross connections.
Message.Actions:
Check the cross connections. How to check the configuration file is detailed in the Trouble Shooting Manual.
2. Check the frequency of input and output I/O signals being actors in cross connections.
3. If an extremely heavy I/O load is normal and required, investigate whether programming delays in the RAPID application may solve the problem.

Message.Title: No communication with I/O unit
Message.Description: During start-up, no communication was established with I/O unit with address on the I/O bus
Message.Consequences: It is not possible to access the I/O unit or I/O signals on it, since it is currently not communicating with the controller.
Message.Causes: The I/O unit is either not connected to the system, or it is connected, but has been assigned the wrong address.
Message.Actions:
1. Make sure all I/O unit addresses match the configuration.
2. Make sure all addresses are unique, and not used by more than one I/O unit.
3. Change the address and/or connect the missing I/O unit.
4. If you changed the address, the power supply to the I/O unit must be cycled (switched OFF and then back ON), to make sure the address has been changed.

Message.Title: No Interbus option has been installed
Message.Description: A Interbus master/slave board has been fitted, but no Interbus option has been installed.
Message.Consequences: No communication on the Interbus is possible. There may be consequential errors from configuring Interbus when no such option has been installed.
Message.Causes: An attempt may have been made to add the Interbus functionality, without installing the option correctly.
Message.Actions:
1. If the Interbus option is required: configure a new system WITH this option, and install the system.
2. If the Interbus option is NOT required: configure a new system WITHOUT this option, and install the system.

Message.Title: Dengensha board failure
Message.Description: No contact with Dengensha PCI board.
Message.Consequences: Dengensha Spot Welding will not be available for use.
Message.Causes: -Dengensha board not present in PCI contact.
Message.Actions:
1. Install the PCI card into one of the main computers PCI slots.
2. Make sure the PCI card is working.

Message.Title: Failed to access the Dengensha PCI board.
Message.Description: The Dengensha PCI board has stopped responding.
Message.Consequences: Dengensha Spot Welding will not be available for use.
Message.Causes: -The board may have internal software or hardware problems.
Message.Actions: Power off and try again

Message.Title: Unknown communication physical channel connector
Message.Description: The connector <> defined for the physical channel <> is unknown.
Message.Consequences: The physical channel will not be available for use.
Message.Causes:
-The connector defined in the physical channel configuration may be misspelt or refers to a connector not available for use.
- Connector configuration is missing.
Message.Actions:
1. Make sure the connector defined in the physical channel configuration is referring to an available connector.
2. Make sure the option Multiple Serial Ports is installed if required by the used configuration.
3. Reinstall the system to make sure the system configuration files are OK.

Message.Title: Communication connector driver is already in use
Message.Description: The connector <> cannot use the driver <>. The driver is already in use by connector <>.
Message.Consequences: The connector and the physical channel using the connector will not be available for use.
Message.Causes:
-The configuration files may have been faulty.
-A configuration file with improperly configured Physical Channels may have been loaded.
Message.Actions:
1. Make sure physical connector configuration is valid.
2. Reinstall the system to make sure the system configuration files are OK.

Message.Title: Communication connector is already in use
Message.Description: The physical channel <> cannot use connector <>. The connector is already in use by physical channel <>.
Message.Consequences: The connector and the physical channel using the connector will not be available for use.
Message.Causes: Several physical channels may have been assigned to the same connector in the configuration.
Message.Actions: Make sure each connector is used by one physical channel only.

Message.Title: DeviceNet watchdog time has expired
Message.Description: The system has not received any reply from the DeviceNet unit, and the watchdog timer has timed out.
Message.Consequences: The DeviceNet bus is NOT running, and no communication on the DeviceNet bus <> will be possible. The system goes to status SYS FAIL. The full meaning of this status is described in the Trouble Shooting Manual, IRC5.
Message.Causes: The I/O load on the DeviceNet bus may be too high, for instance if a RAPID program is trying to set I/O signals at a rate that exceeds the bandwidth available on the DeviceNet bus.
Message.Actions: Reduce the I/O load on the DeviceNet bus.

Message.Title: User defined I/O units can't be connected to the I/O bus <Local>
Message.Description:
The I/O configuration for I/O unit <> is invalid.
No user-defined unit may be connected to the I/O bus <Local>.
This I/O unit has been rejected.
Message.Actions: Correct the I/O configuration.

Message.Title: Request message resource exhausted
Message.Description:
Unable to handle more concurrent IO requests.
Out of concurrent I/O request using delay, pulse, or timeout argument.
Message.Consequences: I/O request cannot be fulfilled.
Message.Causes:
To many I/O instructions with pulse or delay argument.
To many process instructions with pulse, delay or timeout.
Message.Actions:
1. Reduce the number of concurrent I/O instructions with pulse or delay argument.
2. Reduce the number of concurrent process instructions that use pulse, delay or timeout argument.

Message.Title: DeviceNet Quick Connect not supported
Message.Description: The unit type <> may not be connected to the DeviceNet bus as a Quick Connect I/O unit.
Message.Consequences: This unit type has been rejected, and no functions depending on this unit type will work.
Message.Causes: The unit connected may be of a too early version.
Message.Actions:
1. Disable the Quick Connect configuration parameter.
2. Replace the DeviceNet master/slave board with a later version.

Message.Title: Configuration file error
Message.Description:
Errors occurred during loading of configuration data.
All configuration errors are placed in the cfg Event Log.
Message.Consequences: The configuration in file will not be installed.
Message.Actions: View the errors in the cfg Event log.

Message.Title: The DeviceNet bus have recovered from bus off
Message.Description: The DeviceNet bus <> have recovered from bus off state.

Message.Title: System Signal configuration
Message.Description:
There was an error during the configuration of a System Input/Output Signal.
System I/O name:
Message.Consequences: The system will go to state SYS FAIL.
Message.Causes: All errors during configuration of System Input/Output Signals are considered fatal and the system will go to state SYS FAIL.
Message.Actions:
1. Check the connection of the Unit to which the System Signal is connected.
2. Check the configuration of the I/O unit.

Message.Title: Invalid output size
Message.Description: On DeviceNet I/O unit <> the connection 1 output size <> does not match the I/O unit. When using strobe connection the only valid output size are 1 or -1.
Message.Actions:
1. Change size in configuration.
2. Check module.
3. Use DN_GENERIC unit type.

Message.Title: Error when allocating generic size
Message.Description: Failed to allocate generic size (-1) on DeviceNet I/O unit <>.
Message.Causes: The DeviceNet I/O unit <> cannot be configured with unit type DN_GENERIC or with a generic size (-1).
Message.Actions:
1. Update your current unit type configuration with new size.
2. Do not use DN_GENERIC unit type.

Message.Title: Invalid physical communication channel
Message.Description: The communication channel is out of range.
Message.Consequences: The communication channel is unavailable.
Message.Causes: Option not installed or the communication channel <> is out of range.
Message.Actions:
1. Check the allowed minimum and maximum of connectors.
2. Check options required.

Message.Title: No transport protocol
Message.Description: The transport protocol <> for channel <> is missing.
Message.Consequences: The transport instance <> is unavailable.
Message.Causes: The option holding the transport protocol <> is not installed or the protocol name is faulty.
Message.Actions:
1. Install missing option.
2. Change the transport protocol name.

Message.Title: No transmission protocol
Message.Description: The transport protocol <> is missing or the name of the transport protocol is faulty for <>.
Message.Consequences: The application protocol instance <> is unavailable.
Message.Causes: The option holding the transport is not installed or the application name is faulty.
Message.Actions:
1. Install the option.
2. Change the name of the transport in the configuration.

Message.Title: No application protocol
Message.Description: The application protocol <> is missing or the name is faulty.
Message.Consequences: The application instance <> is unavailable.
Message.Causes: The option holding the application protocol is not installed or the protocol name is faulty.
Message.Actions:
1. Install the option.
2. Change the name of the application protocol.

Message.Title: Communication error from bosv24
Message.Description: No response from the serial line.
Message.Actions: Check the device or connection.

Message.Title: Communication error from bosv24
Message.Description: Not possible to deliver the received message.
Message.Actions: Check the communication flow.

Message.Title: Communication error from bosv24
Message.Description: The response from the device has an invalid frame sequence.
Message.Actions: Check for noise on the serial line.

Message.Title: No option exist for the <> Fieldbus Adapter
Message.Description: A <> Fieldbus Adapter has been found, but no option has been installed.
Message.Consequences: No communication on <> Fieldbus Adapter is possible. There may be consequential errors from configuring when no such option has been installed.
Message.Causes: An attempt may have been made to add the <> Fieldbus Adapter functionality, without installing the option correctly.
Message.Actions: If the <> Fieldbus Adapter option is required: configure a new system with this option, and install the system.

Message.Title: Duplicated address on the I/O bus
Message.Description:
The I/O bus address is duplicated on the network.
Conflicting address <>.
Message.Consequences: No communication on the I/O bus is possible.
Message.Actions:
1. Change the address on the conflicting I/O unit (or physically disconnect the I/O unit) or change the address for the I/O bus.
2. Restart the system.

Message.Title: The interval time is invalid
Message.Description: For the DeviceNet unit type <> the connection interval time is invalid.
Message.Causes: The interval time have a lower value than the production inhibit time.
Message.Actions: Change the connection interval time to be higher than the production inhibit time for the unit type <> in the I/O configuration.

Message.Title: Invalid input/output size
Message.Description: The I/O unit <> have a invalid value (zero) for the input or output size.
Message.Actions: Change the input/output size to a value greater value then zero.

Message.Title: Duplicate I/O unit mapping
Message.Description: The I/O signal <> has the same unit mapping as I/O signal <>.
Message.Consequences: Mapping more than one I/O signal against the same bit(s) in the I/O unit map can cause unpredictable values for these I/O signals since their order of evaluation cannot be controlled. E.g. if an inverted group output I/O signal is mapped to the same bits as some digital output I/O signals, the status of these bits are depending on the order the I/O signals are set.
Message.Actions: It is highly recommended that mapping of several I/O signals to the same bit(s) is avoided.

Message.Title: Communication established on DeviceNet bus
Message.Description: The DeviceNet bus <> has established communication.

Message.Title: Route interface not found
Message.Description: The route interface <> for I/O bus <> is not found in the system.
Message.Consequences: The route is not available. Messages to devices connected to <> will not forwarded.
Message.Causes: The I/O bus <> not defined or spelled wrong.
Message.Actions: Change the I/O bus identifier.

Message.Title: Route port number out of range
Message.Description: The given port number of route <> is outside its range.
Message.Consequences: The route is not available. Messages to devices connected to <> will not be forwarded.
Message.Causes: The number is outside its range.
Message.Actions: Change port number.

Message.Title: Not able to add a port to
Message.Description: Not able to define port of route <> due to lack of resources.
Message.Consequences: The route is not available. Messages to devices connected to port is not forwared.
Message.Causes: The <> doesn't support this many ports.
Message.Actions: When possible reduce the number of ports or report the problem to ABB.

Message.Title: CIP route option not installed
Message.Description: The CIP route option is not enabled since it was not selected at system creation.
Message.Consequences: Any CIP route definitions will be omitted.
Message.Causes: The CIP route option is not installed in the system.
Message.Actions: Create and install a system with the CIP route option.

Message.Title: Out of route resources
Message.Description: Not able to add anymore routes due to no more route resources in the system.
Message.Consequences: Route <> will not be added to the system.
Message.Causes: Too many routes have been defined. The system only allows routes.
Message.Actions: Reduce the number of routes.

Message.Title: The DeviceNet bus has regained the bus power
Message.Description: The DeviceNet bus <> has regained the 24 V bus power.

Message.Title: Dengensha option not installed
Message.Description: The Dengensha option has not been correctly installed in the system.
Message.Actions: Reinstall the system using a proper key containing the Dengensha option.

Message.Title: Concurrent changes of signal value
Message.Description: Concurrent changes of I/O signal <> value have been detected.
Message.Consequences: A signal value change of I/O signal <> is aborted due to another value change of the same I/O signal.
Message.Actions: Verify that concurrent value changes are desired of I/O signal <>, otherwise modify the signal change sequence.

Message.Title: No bus power
Message.Description: The 24 V power to the DeviceNet Lean bus is missing.
Message.Consequences: No communication on the DeviceNet Lean bus is possible.
Message.Causes: The power supply unit, cabling, input voltage to the power supply or the output load may cause the power loss. See the trouble shooting section in the manual.
Message.Actions:
1. Make sure that the DeviceNet Lean bus contact is connected.
2. Check all cabling to the power supply unit.
3. Measure the output and input voltage levels.
4. Replace the faulty unit if required.

Message.Title: Bus power restored
Message.Description: The 24 V power to the DeviceNet Lean bus is restored.

Message.Title: DeviceNet Lean hardware missing
Message.Description: The DSQC 572 hardware adapter with the DeviceNet Lean bus contact is missing.
Message.Consequences: No communication on the DeviceNet Lean bus is possible.
Message.Causes: DSQC 572 is missing or the cabling between the main computer unit and DSQC 572 is not inserted.
Message.Actions:
1. Check all cabling.
2. Replace the faulty DSQC 572 hardware adapter if required.

Message.Title: Not allowed vendor
Message.Description: The I/O unit <> connected to the DeviceNet Lean bus is not supported. Reported vendor ID was , expected .
Message.Consequences: No communication to the I/O unit is possible.
Message.Actions:
1. Remove the I/O unit from the configuration.
2. Replace the I/O unit with a supported type.

Message.Title: Not allowed unit type
Message.Description: The I/O unit <> connected to the DeviceNet Lean bus is not a supported DeviceNet Lean module type.
Message.Consequences: No communication to the I/O unit is possible.
Message.Actions:
1. Remove the I/O unit from the configuration.
2. Replace the I/O unit with a supported I/O unit type.

Message.Title: Wrong unit type
Message.Description:
The I/O unit <> connected to the DeviceNet Lean bus is not of the same type as configured.
Reported product code was , expected was .
Message.Consequences: No communication to the I/O unit is possible.
Message.Actions: Change the I/O unit configuration.

Message.Title: Duplicated address on the DeviceNet Lean bus
Message.Description: The reserved address for the DeviceNet Lean master is occupied by an another I/O unit on the network.
Message.Actions:
1. Change the address on the conflicting I/O unit.
2. Disconnect the I/O unit occupying the masters address from the network.

Message.Title: High load on the DeviceNet Lean bus
Message.Description: The amount of traffic on the DeviceNet Lean bus is too high, or the system is too busy to handle all messages on the DeviceNet Lean bus.
Message.Consequences: I/O data might be lost or delayed.
Message.Actions:
1. Change the production inhibit parameter on all configured I/O units.
2. Reduce system load.

Message.Title: Minor error on the DeviceNet Lean bus
Message.Description: A minor amount of communication errors have occurred on the DeviceNet Lean bus.
Message.Consequences: I/O data might be lost or delayed.
Message.Actions: Check all cabling

Message.Title: DeviceNet Lean bus off
Message.Description: A major amount of errors has occurred on the DeviceNet Lean bus. The bus will try to recover when possible.
Message.Consequences: No data exchange with configured I/O units will be possible.
Message.Actions: Check all cabling

Message.Title: DeviceNet Lean too many I/O units
Message.Description: There are too many I/O units configured on the DeviceNet Lean bus. The maximum allowed number is . The I/O unit <> is rejected.
Message.Consequences: No data exchange with I/O unit <> will be possible.
Message.Actions: Remove the I/O unit from I/O configuration.

Message.Title: DeviceNet Lean bus regained
Message.Description: The operating mode of the DeviceNet Lean bus has changed to state running.
Message.Consequences: Data exchange with configured I/O units will be possible.

Message.Title: DeviceNet Lean option key missing
Message.Description: The option key needed to run DeviceNet Lean on the controller was not detected.
Message.Consequences: No communication on I/O bus DeviceNet Lean is possible.
Message.Causes: An attempt may have been made to add the DeviceNet Lean functionality, without installing the option correctly.
Message.Actions:
1. Configure a new system with the DeviceNet Lean option, and install the system.
2. If DeviceNet Lean is not required: configure a new system without this option, and install that system.

Message.Title: DeviceNet Lean I/O unit configured
Message.Description:
A new I/O unit has been found and configured on the DeviceNet Lean bus.
Unit name:
Unit address:
Input bytes / Output bytes:
Vendor ID:
Product code:
Message.Actions:
1. Restart the controller to activate the I/O unit configuration.
2. Edit or delete the configuration.

Message.Title: No configuration in the Profinet PCI board
Message.Description: There is no bus configuration in the Profinet PCI board.
Message.Actions: Download a configuration to the board using an external software tool.

Message.Title: Incompatible firmware in Profinet board
Message.Description: The current firmware in the Profinet PCI board, version <>, is incompatible with this RobotWare release.
Message.Consequences:
Communication on Profinet is not possible.
Automatic firmware upgrade from within the IRC5 controller is not possible.
Message.Causes: The current firmware in the Profinet PCI board is either too old (older than <>) or too new (<> or later).
Message.Actions: Download firmware of version <> to the Profinet PCI board using the Firmware Loader in Siemens Step7. See Application manual: PROFINET master/slave.

Message.Title: Configuration update in progress
Message.Description:
No configuration found in the Profinet PCI board or an external software tool has stopped the Profinet bus.
DO NOT restart the controller until the Profinet configuration is fully downloaded.
Message.Consequences: No connection to I/O units will be possible.
Message.Actions: Use an external software tool to download a configuration and to start the Profinet bus.

Message.Title: Profinet hardware exception
Message.Description: The Profinet PCI board has reported an internal software exception in its firmware. The exception occurred before this restart. Follow the actions steps below to recover from this error state.
Message.Consequences: No connection to I/O units will be possible.
Message.Causes: A configuration download from an external Profinet tool might have been interrupted before it was completed.
Message.Actions:
1. Clear all configuration data in the Profinet PCI board using an external software tool.
2. Reconfigure the Profinet PCI board using an external software tool.
3. Warmstart the controller.

Message.Title: No contact with Profinet PCI board
Message.Description: The Profinet PCI board could not be contacted. Error code returned .
Message.Consequences: No connection to I/O units will be possible.
Message.Causes:
1. The Profinet board is missing or malfunctioning.
2. A new configuration is being downloaded from an external software tool.
Message.Actions: Make sure the Profinet PCI board is installed in the controller.

Message.Title: Profinet bus stopped
Message.Description: A new Profinet configuration has been downloaded using an external software configuration tool. Since the new configuration has major changes, the controller could not reuse the I/O configuration in the controller. A restart is needed.
Message.Consequences: No connection to I/O units will be possible.
Message.Actions: Restart the controller.

Message.Title: Profinet I/O unit not configured
Message.Description:
A Profinet I/O unit at address <> has generated an alarm. The I/O unit is configured in the Profinet PCI board, but not in the controller.
The I/O unit needs to be configured in the controller for the alarm to be handled.
Message.Consequences: No connection to the I/O unit will be possible.
Message.Actions:
1. Add the I/O unit to the controller I/O configuration.
2. Remove the configuration in the Profinet PCI board.

Message.Title: Profinet configuration missing
Message.Description: The I/O unit <> is configured in the controller, but is not found in the Profinet PCI board configuration.
Message.Consequences: No connection to the I/O unit will be possible.
Message.Actions:
1. Add the configuration for the I/O unit in the Profinet PCI board using an external configuration tool.
2. Remove the I/O unit configuration from the system parameters.

Message.Title: Profinet internal slave config warning
Message.Description:
The Profinet internal slave is configured in the controller with the following modules:
The connecting Profinet master have an different module configuration.
Mismatch detected in slot .
Message.Consequences: The connection attempt is rejected.
Message.Actions:
1. Reconfigure the connecting Profinet master.
2. Reconfigure the Profinet internal slave in the controller.

Message.Title: Profinet internal slave configuration warning
Message.Description: The Profinet internal slave is configured in the controller as a byte input module in slot and a byte output module in slot , but the connecting Profinet master have a module configure in slot .
Message.Consequences: The connection attempt is rejected.
Message.Actions: Reconfigure the connecting Profinet master.

Message.Title: Profinet I/O unit diagnostics
Message.Description:
The I/O unit <> has reported diagnostic data in slot <>.
Use I/O unit specific documentation for more explanation on the diagnostic data.

Message.Title: Profinet configuration mismatch
Message.Description: Profinet-IO routing has been configured using an external Profinet configuration tool. To be able to use Profinet-IO routing on the controller, the Profinet internal slave needs to be configured in the controller.
Message.Consequences: No Profinet-IO routing will be possible.
Message.Actions:
1. Add the Profinet internal slave to the I/O configuration.
2. Remove the Profinet-IO routing configuration from the DSQC 678.

Message.Title: Profinet-IO routing warning
Message.Description:
Since Profinet-IO routing is configured on I/O unit <>, some data bits might be dependent on the PLC connection status and operating mode.
If the I/O unit <> has I/O signals mapped on digital output bits controlled by the PLC, these I/O signals can be set by the controller, but will not affect the I/O units output values.
Message.Consequences: Some I/O signals might not be handled by the controller.
Message.Actions:
1. Configure write protection on digital outputs I/O signals mapped by the controller, but controlled by the PLC.
2. Name I/O signals to reflect the fact that they are controlled by the PLC.

Message.Title: Profinet option key missing
Message.Description: The option needed to run Profinet on the controller was not detected.
Message.Consequences: No communication on Profinet bus is possible.
Message.Causes: An attempt may have been made to add the Profinet functionality, without installing the option correctly.
Message.Actions:
1. Configure a new system with the Profinet option, and install the system.
2. If Profinet is not required, configure a new system without this option, and install that system.

Message.Title: Too many Profinet internal slaves
Message.Description: There are too many Profinet internal slaves defined in the controller.
Message.Consequences: Profinet I/O unit <> will not be configured. No communication with this I/O unit will be possible.
Message.Causes: Profinet I/O unit <> is defined as an Profinet internal slave while another Profinet internal slave has already been configured.
Message.Actions: Remove I/O unit <> from the configuration.

Message.Title: Profinet I/O unit alarm
Message.Description: The I/O unit <> has reported an alarm in slot <>:

Message.Title: Profinet PCI board error
Message.Description: The Profinet PCI board could not be found.
Message.Consequences: No connection to I/O units will be possible.
Message.Causes: The Profinet PCI board is not installed or a 'reset to factory settings' command has been performed. The 'reset to factory settings' command demands another restart of the controller in order to be completed.
Message.Actions:
1. Install the Profinet PCI board in the controller.
2. Restart the controller to perform the 'reset to factory settings' command.

Message.Title: Profinet configuration mismatch
Message.Description: Configuration mismatch between the Fieldbus Adapter and the connecting Profinet master in slot .
Message.Consequences: The Fieldbus Adapter will indicate a diagnostic error and no communication will be established between the Fieldbus Adapter and the connecting Profinet master.
Message.Causes: Mismatch of the data type/size in slot for the Profinet master configuration. The expected data type/size is bytes.
Message.Actions:
Correct the data type/size in slot in the external configuration tool or change the data size in the system parameters.
NOTE:
In the Profinet master configuration input data shall be in slot 1 and output data in slot 2.

Message.Title: Too many fieldbus adapters configured
Message.Description: Too many fieldbus adapters configured. It is only allowed to have one fieldbus adapter configured.
Message.Consequences: The fieldbus adapter <> has been rejected, and no functions depending on it will work.
Message.Actions:
1. Remove a fieldbus adapter in the configuration.
2. Restart the system.

Message.Title: EtherNet/IP Master/Slave option not installed
Message.Description: A EtherNet/IP I/O bus is configured, but the EtherNet/IP Master/Slave option has not been installed.
Message.Consequences: No communication on the EtherNet/IP is possible. There may be consequential errors from configuring EtherNet/IP when no such option has been installed.
Message.Causes: An attempt may have been made to add the EtherNet/IP functionality, without installing the option correctly.
Message.Actions:
1. If the EtherNet/IP option is required: configure a new system with this option, and install the system.
2. If the EtherNet/IP option is not required: configure a new system without this option, and install the system.
